Either way, thank you for the response.

text:
@scarletspeed7 "...Evermore's North American release prevented SD3 from getting an NA release on the SNES."
No it didn't. Google Brian Fehdrau, and the first result should be an interview with him.
author: PrinceDoebler

text: @shadowphantom2 It's been inconclusive.  Nintendo has claimed that there was nothing on their end about it.  However, Square Soft has rebutted that in materials about Evermore.  I had an article in Game Informer actually talking about several games that were cancelled in the US for one reason or another, and they included SD3.
author: Rob Lowe

text: @scarletspeed7 I thought there was info to point that it was not the cause for SD3 ever coming out in NA.

author: LAMCL23

text:
Stats Update: Secret of Evermore is the 62nd game on SD's VGM list to reach the 4 song milestone.

Even more impressively, Secret of Evermore is only the third game to reach 4 songs with all songs debuting on this list after number 300.

Evermore is also ironically tied on the list now with Seiken Densetsu 3.  Gamers may not realize that Evermore's North American release prevented SD3 from getting an NA release on the SNES.
author: Rob Lowe

text: One of my favorite SNES games. Queen Bluegarden's theme is my favorite, but I'm a fan of most of the character themes in this game, like this one. I've already said it, but it's mighty impressive that Jeremy Soule was only 19 when he composed the music for this game. The soundtrack has some pretty deep and atmospheric tunes.
